Ten-Day_War.description: A brief armed conflict following Slovenia's declaration of independence from Yugoslavia

consequences: Withdrawal of the JNA from Slovenia
Averted full-scale invasion by the JNA
Slovenia gains full independence from Yugoslavia

context.background: Following President Tito's death, escalating political and ethnic tensions in Yugoslavia
context.significance: Marked the start of the Yugoslav Wars and a series of ethnic struggles in the region
context.military_action: Slovenian Territorial Defence and Police fought against the Yugoslav People's Army
context.first_shot: Fired on 27 June at Divača by an officer of the JNA

key_events: Slovenian control of border posts and international airport at Brnik
Yugoslav People's Army's attempt to secure Slovenia's border crossings
Slovenian Territorial Defence shooting down two YPA helicopters
Major fighting at Nova Gorica and capture of strategic locations by Slovenian forces
Ten-Day_War.aftermath: Despite brief duration, set the stage for subsequent conflicts in the Yugoslav Wars
